pr_title: xds: implement XdsClient thread-safety and synchronization for gRPC client (including refactoring XdsClient to client and server usages separately)

timeline.message: Define the medium layer XdsClient implementation used for both client and server side.
Implement client side XdsClient logic.
Move server side logic into the XdsClient implementation for server side.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:grpc/grpc-java into refactor/separate_client_and_server_xds_client
Make node visible for creating LoadReportClient.
Sync with latest change in master.
Fix bug in sending ACK/NACK when racing with all watchers of that resource type being removed.
Port XdsClientImplTest2 to ClientXdsClientTest.
Port XdsClientImplTestForListener to ServerXdsClientTest.
Move message printer tests into AbstractXdsClientTest.
Only use a single backoffpolicy provider field.
Add Javadoc.
Move the initial resource subscription timeout definition to the concrete XdsClient implementations, as it does not belong to the ADS stream logic.
Hide ADS retry timer in child classes by only exposing a getter.
Rephrase Javadoc.
Document limitations for making Node mutable and visible to child classes.
Create a single LoadReportClient but not start in the constructor of XdsClient, this avoids making channel and backoffpolicy provider visible to child classes, which is a better encapsulation.
Stop load reporting when shutting down the XdsClient.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:grpc/grpc-java into refactor/separate_client_and_server_xds_client
Sync changes for load reporting related APIs.
Abstract out synchronization to decouple its concrete implementation.
Replace SynchronizationContext with a lock for client side XdsClient.
Provides server side synchronization implementation to abstract XdsClient
Expose ScheduledExecutorService via a getter.
Access logger via getter.
Add final to methods not intended to be overriden
Improve comment.
Add TODO for invoking watcher callbacks on its own executor.

timeline.bodyText: This does not seem to be used anywhere. Does it mean there will be another PR for the server side to actually start using ServerXdsClient from the current XdsClientImpl2?
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: Yes, exactly.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.message: Change ServerXdsClient back to take in a stopwatch supplier

timeline.bodyText:
Few comments about this sequence of actions:

if adjustResourceSubscription decided to not issue a request because it's in backoffMode do you still need to set the timer?
why updateNodeMetadataForListenerRequest if you are in backoffMode and not going to issue the request?
can the INFO log statement be issued only if a request is issued (and the timer set)?
if the ServerXdsClient is going to be shared among multiple server instances then updating the common node instance is going to be problematic. Hopefully with the new server side API, modifying Node will not be needed. So we can ignore this problem for now

I understand some of the above was existing code but I understand one of the goals is to fix whatever issues we can fix.
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText:
if adjustResourceSubscription decided to not issue a request because it's in backoffMode do you still need to set the timer?


Yeah, this is something missed. It should check before scheduling the timer. It should call isInBackoff() to check before scheduling the timer. Good catch. Fixed it.


why updateNodeMetadataForListenerRequest if you are in backoffMode and not going to issue the request?


I think in the existing XdsClientImpl2 this is wrong. It should indeed update the Node even if currently in backoff and no request is being sent. Currently in backoff just means we should not send the request now, the retry task will send the request once the timer fires. So even if the retry timer is pending, we should set up the Node properly so that once the timer fires it picks up the latest updated Node for sending the request.


can the INFO log statement be issued only if a request is issued (and the timer set)?


I think it is ok as the log just says it starts watching, which means the watcher is added, not necessarily the resource is requested. It's just for business logic level (the caller of this API does not care about how XdsClient subscribe to the resources, it just need to know that its watcher is added and will be notified later). There are other logs for requests being sent.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: This can be made abstract instead of returning null as I don't see any advantage of providing a default implementation.
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: Sure. Made it abstract.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: Oops. Sorry, my bad. Fixed.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: I highly recommend having a  unit test that checks that ldsRespTimer is not created/set if the client is in backoffMode to catch such things.
replies.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: That needs to be done for client and server side respectively. On the client side we have streamClosedAndRetryRaceWithAddRemoveWatchers. But it doesn't verify the resource subscribe timers. It can be added easily into that test case. But maybe not now. This is an existing behavior, so we should not expect anything related to it to be changed even though it is missing some tests. Also, can you take care of the server side if you want make server side test more robust?
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: ServerXdsClient will also start using resources so I was thinking this can be moved up into AbstractXdsClient but we can hold off on it.
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: No, resource subscription should belong to the business logic layer. So they should be kept here. Basically, the abstract layer should only abstract away the logic of how it send/receive xDS requests/responses.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.message: Should check if currently in backoff before scheduling the initial resource fetch timer for the server side.
Should check if currently in backoff before scheduling the initial resource fetch timer for the server side.
Make getSubscribedResources abstract.

timeline.bodyText:
Behavior of getSubscribedResources as I have understood is:

the one in ServerXdsClient returns null if no watcher set else emptyList
the one in ClientXdsClient returns null instead of emptyList
over here if it is null you change it back to emptyList

Why can't we then have getSubscribedResources return emptyList instead of null? So null should never be returned unless I am missing something
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText:
The problem really comes from the ServerXdsClient's implementation. As you mentioned, returning null and empty list means different things for ServerXdsClient: null indicates nothing is being subscribed to and when the ADS stream is recreated, no request should be sent. While empty list does mean it is currently subscribing to the wildcard Listener resource, and a request need to be sent when the ADS stream is recreated.
ClientXdsClient's implementation will always return null if nothing being subscribed to, or a non-empty list. It has to be consistent with ServerXdsClient's semantics. It cannot return an empty list as its semantics has alreayd been taken. The abstract layer does not know if the real implementation is a ServerXdsClient or a ClientXdsClient.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText:
Okay, thanks for the clarification. I thought the client side (ClientXdsClient) also uses wildcard queries (since they are supported for clusters and listeners) but it looks like our client-side never needs to issue wild-card queries because of the specific use-case of proxyless gRPC (unlike Envoy which uses wildcard queries to get all the clusters and listeners in the mesh).
The server side will also now use specific resources (assuming TD implements the new API) so the emptyList case should never happen and this code can then be cleaned up.
replies.author: sanjaypujare

timeline.bodyText: Can you just call handleStreamRestarted() to eliminate code duplication? because you are using constants etc it will be helpful in eliminating trivial errors.
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText:
No, that's wrong. handleStreamRestarted() should be effectively abstract, only the abstract layer should call it. Concrete layers should only provides the implementation to the abstract layer.
Also, upon stream recreated, it should only schedule the timer if the resource has not been resolved (as the management server can choose to not send resources already sent in the previous stream). This is a pending change/bugfix.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: ClientXdsClient has cleanUpResourceTimers. We can combine the 2 into 1 abstract method cleanUpResourceTimers in AbstractXdsClient which might also simplify the code at call sites.
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: No, cleanUpResourceTimers should be concrete implantation's own logic. The abstract layer does not aware how concrete implementations subscribing to resources. This cleanUpResourceTimer method is just a helper method in the concrete implementation, it's used for both XdsClient shutdown and handleStreamClosed callback.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: This has only MessagePrinter tests and MessagePrinter is only used in log messages and not for any functionality. So these tests don't test any functionality, is that correct?
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: The XdsClient's behaviors (including functionalities such as ADS stream closed and retry implemented in the abstract layer) are tested in each of the concrete implementations (see ClientXdsClientTest and ServerXdsClientTest). In high-level, it's more like a blackbox test.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: You can delete now, otherwise it will fail to build.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Sure. Updated.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Hmm, the enum value doesn't carry the raw type name (aka, typeUrl), this method is already using abstracted information. The real type URL should have been logged in the raw message, so it should be good enough to just warn with the the unknownness.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: Yeah, we can't print the actual type name.

timeline.bodyText:
The method has almost identical name as handleRpcStreamClosed().
So propagateStreamError() might be a better name, as it's propagating error to the watchers.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I think handleStreamClosed() is better aligned with other "abstract" methods. Calling it "propagate" may not be that appropriate as this is actually how inheritance works. It is not directly calling another classes' method,  it is calling itself's method.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: Not a big deal. Just felt names are too closed.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: stubV2 can be moved into start() as a local variable.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Sure. Cleaned up the AdsStreamV2 and AdsStreamV3 naming as well, made the class itself more descriptive.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: Usages of adjustResourceSubscription  seem not synchronized in the sense of runWithSynchronized().
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText:
Which usage specifically? All of its invocations should have been holding the lock.
But, btw, I am highly suspecting the server side SynchronizationContext is wrong. It is already wrong in XdsClientWrapperForServerSds. It doesn't synchronize anything, because only tasks from the XdsClient's channel thread are scheduled into it.
/cc @sanjaypujare You probably do not understand how those threads work.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: Basically, calling into XdsClient's API (e.g., XdsClient.watchListenerData()) should also be from inside the SynchronizationContext. Even the existing server side usage is wrong.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: Oh, sorry, I forgot they were inside lock and misunderstood the code.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Pass supplier of stopwatch to the abstract layer.
Fixed typo.
Ensure the abstract layer is requesting for LDS resources.
Cleaned up AdsStream naming.
Add log for sending a client initiated xDS request.
